distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text: Security update for the Linux Kernel
notes.title: Title of the patch

notes.text:
The SUSE Linux Enterprise 12 SP1 kernel was updated to fix the following two issues:

- CVE-2017-5970: Remote attackers could have potentially caused a denial of service by sending
 bad IP options on a socket (bsc#1024938)
- Fix a regression in MD RAID1 which could have caused wrong data to be read (bsc#1020048)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

document.title: Security update for the Linux Kernel

notes.text: The ipv4_pktinfo_prepare function in net/ipv4/ip_sockglue.c in the Linux kernel through 4.9.9 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (system crash) via (1) an application that makes crafted system calls or possibly (2) IPv4 traffic with invalid IP options.
notes.title: CVE description
